org.smartfrog.services.filesystem.files
Class Fileset

java.lang.Object
  org.smartfrog.services.filesystem.files.Fileset
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Fileset
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

This is conceptually similar to an Ant FileSet, but architecturally very different. It represents a set of files with a (possibly null) base directory. It is marked as serialisable... the list of files will get sent over.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Fileset

public Fileset(java.io.File baseDir,
               FilenamePatternFilter filter)
Create a fileset from a filter. This can calculate the fileset on demand

Parameters:
baseDir - directory to work from
filter - filter to use

Fileset

public Fileset(java.io.File baseDir,
               java.io.File[] files)
create a static fileset

Parameters:
baseDir - base directory, can be null
files - list of files -should be an empty list if there are no files

Fileset

public Fileset(Files files)
        throws SmartFrogException,
               java.rmi.RemoteException
Construct a fileset from a files instance (Which may be remote)

Parameters:
files - the component that knows about the files
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - when the network plays up
SmartFrogException - if something else went wrong

Get a diagnostics message

Returns:
the diagnostics string

listFiles

public java.io.File[] listFiles()
Return a list of files that match the current pattern. This may be a compute-intensive operation, so cache the result. Note that filesystem race conditions do not guarantee all the files listed still exist...check before acting

Returns:
a list of files that match the pattern, or an empty list for no match

recalculate

public void recalculate()
Recalculate the fileset and update our cache. Has no effect if the component is caching someone else's value
